author: hugo_delacruz
content:
Hi, I want to share the analysis we've made based on this proposal to charge
350 gas for accessing code chunks: https://notes.ethereum.org/@vbuterin/code_chunk_gas_cost

The analysis shows how this would impact gas usage at block level, and also
shows how this would be in transaction level, for example in transactions
calling the most gas consuming-contracts (according to ethgasstation)

You can see the analysis and results here: https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/code-chunk-cost-analysis

author: timbeiko
content: We seem to have consensus about adding an `eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas` endpoint to the JSON RPC spec in order to leave the functionality of `eth_gasPrice` unchanged post-1559. TBD on exactly _what_ `eth_maxPriorityFeePerGas` would return (will discuss this Friday on the Gas API Call), but if people have objections about having that API at all, now would be the time to raise them on the PR: https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/pull/201
